wikipedia_page.main: Malcolm Alexander MacLean (August 14, 1844 – April 4, 1895) was the first mayor of Vancouver, British Columbia, serving from 1886 to 1887.

response: *April 4 – Malcolm Alexander MacLean, 1st Mayor of Vancouver (b.1842)
*August 14 – Malcolm Alexander MacLean, 1st Mayor of Vancouver (died 1895)
* Malcolm Alexander MacLean (1842–1895), Canadian politician, Mayor of Vancouver, BC 1886–1887
*Malcolm Alexander MacLean, first Mayor of Vancouver, serving 1886 to 1887.

*1886 – The Town of Granville is incorporated as the City of Vancouver (the name was in fact chosen by the President of Canadian Pacific Railway). Rate-payers elect Malcolm Alexander MacLean, a real estate dealer, as the first mayor of Vancouver. The city has a population of about 1,000 people.
